summary.p: Dialogues on the Old Testament, that is, on Joshua, Judges, Kings 1, and Kings 2. Second part of a 3-volume manuscript: part one and three are BnF Indien 451 and BnF Indien 453.
Description based on the examination of the original manuscript (April 2021).
Dimensions assessed at the time of examination.

msItem.title: Callāpaṅkaḷ: Mūlam
msItem.finalRubric: In-text chapter completion statements. See selection below.

collation.desc: 1 folio = Callāpaṅkaḷ: Completion Statement (added to the bundle). No foliation. Double folio. Verso blank. 160 x 25 mm.
4 folios = front guard leaves. No foliation. Blank recto verso. 305 x 30 mm.
260 folios = Callāpaṅkaḷ: Text. Tamil foliation 1-260. 30/35 x 305/365 mm.
6 folios = back guard leaves. No foliation. 305 x 30 mm.

additions.desc: BnF shelfmark sticker: INDIEN 452 (front cover, recto).
Contents on a paper sheet inserted betweenfront cover and U1: Dialogues sur Josue Juges Ruth premier & segond des Roys.

origin.origDate: 1729 at the latest. Dated to 1739 by Vinson in Vinson et al. (1866-) on the basis of the colophon. Dated to 1739 by Cabaton (1912), on unstated grounds. Internally dated to the year 1606 of an unstated era (U3, f260r3). It is not clear if this is the date of copy or the date copied from the master copy, if any.

provenance.p: Possibly copied in Pondicherry by Tamil Catholic converts.

acquisition.p: This manuscript appears to be the second of three volumes referred to as a single-volume Bible and Bible en Malabar ou Tamoul sent by the Jesuits of the Mission du Carnate in 1729 for the library of the king of France and mentioned in ancien lists (BnF NAF 5442, f5r and f9r). These lists state that this Bible, as well as the next two items in the list are printed by the Lutheran missionnaries from Tranquebar and are from the Danish Protestants.

listBibl.bibl: Cabaton, Antoine. 1912. Catalogue sommaire des manuscrits indiens, indo-chinois & malayo-polynésiens. Bibliothèque nationale. Département des manuscrits. Paris: E. Leroux. — See p. 64, no. 452.
S.n. 1739. Catalogus codicum manuscriptorum Bibliothecae regiae. Tomus primus. Pars prima, complectens codices manuscriptos orientales. Paris: Typographia Regia. — See p. 434, no. I.
Vinson, Julien & Feer, Léon & s.n. 1866-. Catalogue des manuscrits tamoul et télinga. Manuscript, BnF Indien 577. — See f. 103r, no. 419 452.

encodingDesc.p: General ― Unmarked length of ō and ē supplied. Unmarked puḷḷi supplied. Conjectural reading (text unclear) between parentheses. Supplied reading (text lost) between square brackets. Alternative readings separated by slash. In transliteration ― Unmarked elided overshort u supplied as an apostrophe. Uppercase for initial vowels. Symbols between curly brackets. Abbreviations ― c = column; f = folio; lf = library foliation; lm = left margin; r = recto; rm = right margin; u / U followed by a number = unit (codicological and/or textual); v = verso.
